thread.title: Apaches get homecoming win over struggling Ozark
thread.title_full: Apaches get homecoming win over struggling Ozark

author: Jeff Piker (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Apaches get homecoming win over struggling Ozark
text: Apaches get homecoming win over struggling Ozark by Jeff Piker The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:35 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 108 views | 0 | 0 | | POTTSVILLE — The Pottsville Apaches grabbed a 39-7 homecoming victory on Friday at John Needham Stadium over the Ozark Hillbillies.The Apaches (4-2, 3-0 4A-4 Conference) offense scored touchdowns on each of their five first half possessions. Pottsville’s defense forced the Ozark offense into three punts and two turnovers in their first half possessions and held the Hillbillies to a total of 47 yards of total offense.The Apaches took eight plays to score their first touchdown. Josh Dugger punched it in from two yards out with 5:29 left in the opening quarter. Stephen Judkins added the PAT giving the Apaches an early 7-0 lead. After forcing a Ozark punt, Pottsville took over at the Hillbilly 44-yard line. This time, the Apaches took nine plays to score. Josh Dugger caught the touchdown pass from Jake from the 26-yard line.Pottsville other first half drives were for 85 yards, 56 yards and 43 yards. With Jake Dugger scoring one and fullback Austin McNeely scoring the other two. Pottsville amassed ver 300 yards in total offense in the first half.The Apaches final score of the evening came at the 4:07 left in the third quarter. Ozark quarterback Hayden Atkinson dropped back to pass and Pottsville’s Kyle Reynolds stepped in front of the intended receiver and outraced the Hillbillies to the end zone for the 68-yard score.Jake Dugger finished the night for the Apaches going 7-of-12 passing for 96 yards and two touchdowns. Jake Dugger and Austin McNeely led the Pottsville rushing attack. Josh Duger had two touchdown receptions for the Apaches. Ty Maness led the Apache defense with 11 tackles.“We played pretty well tonight. offensively we moved the ball well in the first half and our assign game is coming around,” Pottsville head coach Bryan Rust said. “We kept them off balance with our defense and never let them get on track. We have a big game coming next week and we will have to play well.”The Apaches will host Dover on Friday.
